did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
World War I Wall Hanging and Photographs
1917-1919
did.abstract: World War I wall hanging done in American flag design with sentimental verse and pocket, n.d.; and 3 small photographs of unidentified soldiers one of which is labelled "Aug 6 Waiting for inspection," on the verso.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World War I Wall Hanging and Photographs, ca. 1917-1919, in the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection, Accession #10875-az, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items were given to the University of Virginia Library Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection by Matthew J. Bruccoli, Columbia, South Carolina, on April 15, 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection, ca. 1917-1919, consists of a wall hanging with a patriotic design expressing these sentiments, "Remember Me" "Sweet be to thee life's passing hours, And all thy path be decked with flowers" on the top half and an American flag design for the bottom half, which also forms a pocket. It also includes three black and white photographs of unidentified groups of [American?] soldiers, one with the inscription, "Waiting for Inspection, August 6."
